content: And the day of death than the day of oneâ€™s birth;
Better to go to the house of mourning
Than to go to the house of feasting,
For that  the end of all men;
And the living will take  to heart.
For by a sad countenance the heart is made better.
The heart of the wise  in the house of mourning,
But the heart of fools  in the house of mirth.
I have seen everything in my days of vanity:
